title: Freestyle Remix Challenge 4 - Laudatio
content:
See also:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/14378](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/typophile.com/node/14378) \_  
 [http://typophile.com/node/15175](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/typophile.com/node/15175) \_  
 [http://typophile.com/node/15361](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/typophile.com/node/15361) \_

Normally I would have waited for #3 to run its course,  
but this scrap of paper on my desk is driving me crazy  
so I’m just going to throw this out:

Poppl Laudatio has been one of my favorite fonts since  
the mid-90s. I especially like to use it for on-screen  
work because it’s so shallow\* without being devoid of  
character - in fact it’s one of the very few fonts that  
I use both (very) small/lo-fi and very large. I think  
Poppl really knew what he was doing, and we’re very  
lucky to have such a design available.

\* [http://typophile.com/node/15367](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/typophile.com/node/15367)

**The thing is, many people always complain about its  
ampersand. You can think “they need an education” but  
the fact remains it can be useful to have a “conventional”  
ampersand for it. So let’s make one.**

Being a Berthold font it’s become hard to view through  
other font houses (can’t really blame them I guess)\* like the  
always-great-for-a-preview Myfonts. You can see a cruddy  
GIF\*\* on their site, but I would recommend downloading the  
the PDF that shows all their “Hybrid” fonts, from here:  
 [http://www.bertholdtypes.com/bq\_library/BQ\_library.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/BQ_library.html)

\* In fact I’d strongly recommend remaining squeaky-clean-legal  
 on this one. Maybe read the PDF usage conditions on their site,  
 and definitely only work with just renderings of the letterforms,  
 not original outlines.

\*\* [http://www.bertholdtypes.com/bq\_library/90089.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/90089.html)

comments.content: [Phil’s Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20060525045601/http:/www.philsfonts.com/) has pretty decent previews of Berthold character sets. If I were to buy a Berthold font, that’s where I’d go.
